name: pestilential
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal relating to or causing very serious infectious disease that spreads quickly and kills large numbers of people: Smallpox is clearly the worst of the pestilential diseases. In the story, a pestilential fog envelops every population centre in the country.
full of insects or small animals that are dirty or cause disease : They were sent there from the pestilential slums of New York City. They figured it would be a simple matter of digging a few canals through the pestilential swamp and letting its waters pour out to sea.
(of an animal) existing in large numbers and causing a problem: That evening, the talk was of the desert and of the pestilential flies. Deer were threatening to reach "pestilential levels" in places.
used to emphasize that you find something unpleasant or annoying: Some pestilential scientist has invented a device that allows parents to trace their child's location via their mobile telephone. Part of the delight of Venice is its freedom from the pestilential motor car.
